Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Ana P
Reviews.Content: We will definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone. Pictures in the web site are very deceiving: Room is very small (have to push the beds together so we can pull the chair out from the desk). Bed is very hard. Pillow is not comfortable. Stain on the wall, mildew in the bathroom, tub was very dirty (we have to clean it ourselves before we use it). Writing on the headboard that it looks like the hotel staff tried to clean it with bleach but not succesful. Hotel staff not very helpful and doesn't know how to speak English (which is very frustrating). No internet access at all. The advantages staying in this hotel is the hotel is just across from Roma Termini (Train Station) and the subway. Breakfast was good - they have scramble egg with ham, several choices of deli meat, cold fruits, lots of bread choices.

Reviews.Title: “Price & Location= Success”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Rome during Easter weekend for a short stay which was never a great idea as hotels and streets are thronged with people! Prices for hotels also magically increase during this time...... Arrived at hotel and were slightly wary of it at first as carpets in corridors are in a bad need of changing! The labyrinth which are the corridors can be also be off putting. Pleasant surprise as room was a nice size and bathroom was great! Best shower I've had in a long time which is always badly needed after a long day trekking around the city! Even though the weather wasn't very warm, I thought the air conditioning in the room didn't seem great for the sweltering heat which you can have in Rome? Reception staff I encountered were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was also nice and kept us all fed and energised well until lunch time. Variety of breads, pastries, cold meat, scrambled eggs and the all important coffee helped to keep us all happy! Being opposite to Termini was a huge advantage with metro and bus links. Would most certainly come back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Logie88
Reviews.Content: By Rome standards this is a budget hotel, set in the rather seedy area around the Termini station. With three friends I booked it for a rugby trip, when the hotel we normally use was full up. I was surprised to find it had quadruple rooms and, since we tend to spend very little time in the hotel on these trips, we booked one. In the event one of our party couldn't make it, but we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and the huge bathroom. It was fine for three and would have been adequate for four. Like most Rome hotels of this type there is little public space and the corridors and staircases are somewhat threadbare and in need of renovation. However the room itself was well maintained with marble floors and good storage. The breakfast room is not as cramped as some and the breakfast buffet was better than many other similar Rome hotels. Coffee and fruit juice are fine and there is a choice of cereals, scrambled egg, cold meat, cheese, bread pastries and cake. We had a slight problem the first night with noise from a school party who were running about the corridors. However order was eventually restored and the school party left next day and there was no repeat. The staff were friendly and helpful and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as good value in its price bracket. It is located almost immediately opposite the side entrance of the Temini station and about 100 yards from the stop for the express bus to the airport. The metro station is part of the Termini complex although the ticket machines are a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “June of '08- Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Jakostan
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place. It's really close to the Termini, so location wise this place is absolute perfection. Great rooms, helpful staff, very classy place. I came here on a pilgrimage and this place is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good location friendly front office staff”
Reviews.Author: Sadeck
Reviews.Content: Good location.helpful and friendly staff at the reception.room and breakfast ok

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Marie E
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel was okay. Breakfast was fine. The room was okay. But very dark because you could not open the blinds. There wasn't a fridge at the room, which was bad, because of the heat outside in october. The man at the counter is not service minded, but the women are. But we had a good stay in Rome me and my mom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & comfortable hotel - MT”
Reviews.Author: Anth_Spiteri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off Termini station, area is busy but the location of the hotel is great. All staff in hotel was helpful and once in the hotel you receive a warm welcome. Breakfast was excellent and abundant with all varieties.

Reviews.Title: “Second Timer at Hotel Madison”
Reviews.Author: Bella D
Reviews.Content: Best word to describe Hotel Madison is "at the center of all convenience". The hotel is few steps from: the train central station, city tour buses, taxis, shuttle/airport buses, you can walk to the places you want to see, restaurants, pharmacy and convenience stores. Towels are always changed everyday. Bedsheets are clean. Bed is comfortable. Staff are friendly, helpful and approachable. Continental breakfast is abundant. The walls are noise proof so it does not matter how noisy it is outside, you still have a good night sleep. In case you are not happy with the condition of your room or having problem with the aircondition unit, just report it to the staff, they are very accommodating. Because of the above review, I booked my hotel with them again. See you Hotel Madison the next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad...”
Reviews.Author: myzweicents
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome. Thanks to all the comments here i had really low expectation from this hotel. So why still chose this hotel? Because of the nearnest to central train station, the relatively low price and because other hotels were booked out. So therefore i was pleasantly suprised when it wasn't as bad as i thought. Okay. Location: GREAT! No problem with breakfast either. Scrambled eggs with bacon, cheese, ham, sausages, sweet croissants, buns, hard-boiled eggs...hot water for tea, hot milk for making hot chocolate and coffee. The only thing awful were the juices. Waiter and waitresses were friendly and helpful. The men at the counter did not appear friendly but then again, we had no reasons to chat with them. They were friendly enough when we checked in and when we paid. Now to the rooms. We booked a Quadruple Room. It was all occupied when we arrived. So we got two double bed rooms for the price of the one Quad Room. Room 1 was done up in gold (lovely) and faced the side road. The sound-proofed windows really cut down the noise level but if you need to sleep with the windows open (for personal reasons or because aircond not working) then it gets loud. Bathroom really clean. Some days we got plenty of towels some days less (?). Kept topping up the bars of soap (heh?). Mattresses were alright. Room 2, hmmm, not exactly to my liking. The blue colour (or is it green) is a bit strange. My young teenagers did not mind though. Could it be that because this room has a view of these three dirty walls (airwell) the size of room was much bigger. A lot of space to move around. Bathroom was also clean. Number of towels constant. But the beds! If felt like a few heavy men has been sleeping on it. You just sink in the middle. Again for children's weight, was not a problem. So i think where the mattresses are concerned it has a lot to do with luck what you get. The children also loved the hotel labyrinth, what the adults would say irritating. All in all, for the price we paid, i think we got our money's worth. Would i stay there again? In the vicinity, definately. In the same hotel, well, not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: ljr58
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Madison, and again it was comfortable, clean and well appointed, with gracious concierge help as well as a full delicious breakfast. The location - a few steps from the termini is like all of Rome - busy with lots of foot and motor traffic - but well insulated windows create a quite restful spot. The Madison offers a great value with a convenient address.

Reviews.Title: “Made us move to another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mnanne
Reviews.Content: Agree with the reviews of the other travelers and quite happy that a room for us wasnt available! The receptionist is unfriendly and made us wait (it was HOT!) while she cooly told us that a whole floor of the hotel was under renovation - frankly we couldnt believe one bit of what she said. Even the area where it is situated (right outside the station) looks grungy and dirty. So glad we were moved to a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jayson J
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 days. Rooms were not available for check in at 2:00 p.m. The unfriendly receptionist made us stand around till the rooms were ready (only 2 seats in the reception). AC didnt work. Locks got jammed. Vending machine ate all the money. The hotel website advertises free WiFi - but that is just a big lie. Never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “More of a 2-star hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: FifiBrink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to its proximity to Termini Station. We stayed for a total of 3 nights. The first room they gave us had an awful stench of mould. We complained with the day receptionist and was told that someone would have a look at the room whilst we were out. When we returned there was a different receptionist who knew nothing about our complaint. We went up to the room hoping that they fixed the problem (although honestly we could not figure out how one could remove the stench of mould in such a short time!!!). The room still had an awful smell, at which point we complained again. A maintenance guy was sent over to check and told us that the smell was due to the wallpaper being cleaned but left to dry without opening the windows, hence the stench. He suggested we open the windows for a short while. As soon as we did so the stench of mould was replaced with an awful smell of fried food. We again complained and asked for a new room. We were told that none was available, but they promised they would change our room the next day upon other guests departing. They changed the room and gave us a room that had no smell but had an awfully filthy bath (vide photos). Worst of all was the continious humming noise that could be heard in this room that was caused possibly by some sort of machinery placed on the roof (on top of our room). We could not sleep at all because of the noise!!! Definitely not 3-star material, hardly worthy of a 2-star category.

Reviews.Title: “we wont come back”
Reviews.Author: hapi q
Reviews.Content: in fact, i havent stay in this hotel. because this hotel cant offer the room to us! i was so disappointed n angry. when they cant offer the room to us, they send us to another hotel (DOCK) which is 2 stations far away form the main train station. what make me book this hotel is the location! how come they can do the business like this??? and i sent many e-mails to confirm my booking before i check-in, but do not have any reply! after i changed the hotel, i still can c they say they "have room" n can book online! (the days are as same as my sleeping days) so i totally think that they are cooperate with other small hotel! and i meet other travellers in DOCK also booked this hotel but need to change it. i would never book this hotel anymore! p.s the staff are rude!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel with an outstanding breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: RRtravellers
Reviews.Content: The Madison Hotel is conveniently located right across from the train station. The room was very clean, nice bathroom and the best continental breakfast we had throughout our travels. Our bed was comfortable and a very quiet hotel considering the location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They allowed us to store our bags for the day so we could sight see. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Excellent value for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel: More of a 2-plus star”
Reviews.Author: Roman T
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if you are in Rome for one night and need convenient access to the train station or airport. If you are looking for Roman atmosphere, some kind of decent view, perhaps some romance and ambience, you won't find it here. The Madison is directly across from the train station - great, but generally speaking, the areas around most train stations around the world are seedy and Rome's train station is no exception. Although the Madison itself was a clean hotel, it did not feel clean. Its rooms were dark and extremely small - even according to European standards. The hotel photos look beautiful with dark wood and walls however, this only added to the feeling of claustrophopia. In general, this hotel is OK but I would recommend paying a little extra for something a little nicer - Afterall, it is ROME!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley_LF
Reviews.Content: Here's our list of complaints: The water temperature fluctuated from freezing cold to scalding hot in a matter of seconds and changed throughout the shower; the air conditioner made so much noise that we couldn't sleep; the staff acted like we were an inconvenience; one of the elevators seemed like it was about to break (if you could even get them); and there was no internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussie1travellers
Reviews.Content: The day we arrived at this hotel it was 35 degrees and as we had just flown and then had to catch a train from the airport in which we were forced to stand with our luggage for an hour we just wanted to rest in our room with a cool drink. When we got there the receptionist was not very friendly and when we got to our room we discovered there was no fridge. I have stayed at many hotels and this is unusual for a hotel. The aircon is also regulated by the hotel which could have been cooler. You can hear every sound that is coming from the rooms around and above you and as this is a contiki stop it did become quiet noisy through parts of the evening. Also water from the shower leaked all over the floor and you had to be careful not to slip. A positive for this hotel was the breakfast which is included in the price and is very nice with a a variety of hot and cold food to choose from. However overall for the price it is not worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel full of liars”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter0089
Reviews.Content: Well 4 of us adults planned our trip to Europe. We planned our trip well in advance and even though we did our booking of Hotel Madison atleast 2 weeks in advance, we were not given our rooms as guranteed. Apparently the Hotel had over-booked and put us in their sister hotel, Hotel Galle. We had to drag our bags a good 10 minutes away (while they had said that the hotel is VERY NEAR-BY) and when we finally arrived at our hotel we were given two rooms in another building of Hotel Galle. The lift must be one of the earliest lifts invented as it was a small cubicle with grills all around it and hardly carried 2 people. If you were inside the lift, you could hear and talk to the outside people. Finally we got to our rooms to find that they werent next to each other, they were Red in color with hardly any light at night. The AC also leaked and the TV hardly worked. It was just a nightmare. To top everything there was no wi-fi. I would seriously ask everyone to re-think their visit to Hotel Madison and if still want to book there then you should double or triple check your booking in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , basic amenties ..overall nice”
Reviews.Author: Stacy020
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days ...the hotel is very convienently located right across the Termini ... Having said that , it isnt noisy .. Breakfast was very good. The rooms are a bit small and the AC is not very cooling but overall it was pretty decent and value for money. The only drawback was that we arrived at 10am in the morning after a really long journey of 10hrs and the guy at the reception didnt allow us to check in until 2pm sharp ...we went at 1:30 to see if he would allow us as we were dead tired ..but he kept saying that our room wasnt ready :-S

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: iogeorgia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right opposite to Termini which is the place where all the subway lines, trains and most bus lines start and stop. So, every morning we took our breakfast (nothing fancy, but decent - the table clothes weren't clean) and we jumped into the first train to get to our destination. Also, when we returned at night exhausted from walking around all day long and a bit dizzy from the great Italian wine we could easily take any bus which stopped outside the hotel. What is more, the hotel is within walking distance from the Fontana di Trevi and many other nice pizzerias and tratorias. Inside the termini there is a mall where you can find clothes shops, fast food restaurants and a supermarket. The rooms were relatively spacious and soundproof. The beds were very comfortable with clean sheets. The bathroom was really classy and clean (and believe me I am really particular when it comes to cleanliness). Great value for money! When we visit Rome again, we will definitely stay at the Madison hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, wonderful service, great stay”
Reviews.Author: ljr58
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome many times, and this by far is the best value priced hotel the Eternal City offers. Though budget priced, the rooms are immaculate; beds comfortable, and the offered breakfast plentiful offering a delicious variety of pastries, proteins, and fruit. The staff is warm and welcoming, dining room service efficient and gracious. Directly across the street from the Termini, sound proofed windows offer a quiet night's rest for the weary traveler.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kenjude
Reviews.Content: My family (2kids ages 3 &1 and 3 adults) came to this hotel 2days earlier than our booking even if it was high-peak time. We don't have a hard time getting our rooms. The hotel is very convenient as it is only across Termini Station. Breakfast is great too. All the receptionist are helpful and can speak English. We got our free coats as a token of our long stay.

Reviews.Title: “madison rome”
Reviews.Author: venera malteser
Reviews.Content: Madison Hotel is very central 20mtr in front of Termini Station ,clean,good breakfast and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Pieter50_11
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable hotel, big rooms, good beds, large bathroom, clean room, good breakfast. One thing good be better and that is the personal serving the breakfast. They should be more friendly with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: arianashok
Reviews.Content: Advantages: 1. Location: The location was very good as it was right across the Termini station, from where you could travel anywhere in Rome. You could also catch the train the Leonordo DaVinci Airport by the airport train service. 2. Breakfast: The breakfast was included in the rent and it was good. 3. Staff: The staff spoke good English(at least the ones in the reception) and were helpful. Disadvantages: 1. Lack of internet in the hotel and the rooms. 2. Room was nothing special and the single bed was too small. But overall, a decent hotel in the center of Rome close to Termini station as well as the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “With reference to convenience couldn't have asked for better!!”
Reviews.Author: Malaika54 Posted by a Cleartrip traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked two hotels for our 5 day trip to Rome, 4 nites at the Madison and one nite at the Capannelle! The Madison was an excellent choice in terms of close proximity to all the sites and the Termini Central and Metro station was just across the road, so was the bus terminal, where one could travel all over Rome or Italy. The staff at the hotel were very obliging, whether it was the Reception, the housekeeping or the wait staff at the breakfast room!! Rooms were cleaned every day and towels replaced. Mattresses were not the best, and the bathroom washbasin kept clogging, but for the price I guess one couldn't get better!! Breakfast was routine everyday,without variety, but I have had the same wherever I travelled in Europe. Since I stayed in another hotel, I am able to compare the two and say that I had many regrets leaving the Aedes Madison, as I would have been happier to continue staying there. The reason I changed was because being a first time visitor to Rome, I thought it would be convenient to catch flights from Ciampino airport and Fiumicino,(as one of us was flying out of Ciampino and the rest from Fuimicino) but how mistaken I was!!! Apart from being very uncomfortable, we ended up paying much more to reach the airports, than what we would have paid, had we had stayed on at the Madison.

Reviews.Title: “Good news bad news stay”
Reviews.Author: woodsman7
Reviews.Content: Right next to main train station with clean rooms and hearty breakfast, but in a tired building in dire need of renovations. Hallways are dirty and the air conditioning is a joke. The indifferent staff never warned us about the unsafe tap water but still insisted on charging for bottled water. Very busy with tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “termini is just across the road for a heafty price tag!”
Reviews.Author: WassimE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely near Termini, literally across the road from it and it was fully booked all the time we stayed there (4 nights) yet the price was at list double what is should really be for what was on offer. OK so this is Rome and all is expensive but at this price you could really do better than this. i have been in Rome many times before and was stuck for a place as i booked really late hence why i ended up here. next time i would have changed the destination to anther city rather than stay in places like this.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JCasillas
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Fiumicino Airport, a.k.a Leonardo Da Vinci airport. You can catch the Leonardo Express directly from the airpor to Termini Station (about a 30 minute ride) and then a 10-15 minute walk to the hotel through the station. We got lost, so here is my best advice...walk towards the exit, before you walk out the doors, you should see stairs/escalators leading down...follow them and the passageway to the train station. People will help, so just ask. Forget the line at the "ticket booth", hit the tabacco shop on the opposite side. They sell tickets for the "Leonardo Express" (tell them the name). About 14 euros per person. We stayed at this hotel for a total of 4 days and 3 nights. We only used the hotel at night to sleep. So, for that purpose it was great. There were three people in my party and we got a "triple" room. There were 3 twin sized beds all pushed together to make one large bed. We pulled the beds apart (they are on casters) and arranged them in opposite sides of the room, much more comfortable. The staff never said anything and they left them the way we arranged them for the duration of our stay. The room was a good size and had a great bathroom. It was early September when we visited, so the a/c was still functioning. I hear they turn off a/c access after September. There is a small fridge with two 16 oz bottles of water. This fridge never kept anything colder than "cool". We thought it was broken, except for the fact that we could hear it kick on. The location could not have been better. The hotel is literally across the street from Termini Station. All metro lines pass through here and the major bus station is on the opposite side of the street. Taxis are everywhere, but beware...if it's not white or green and has a taxi sign on the roof, it's not a real taxi. If you don't see a meter, it's not a real taxi. This means the driver will charge whatever they like. This unfortunately happened to us once, and we paid 12 euros (about $18). Not too bad, but on the return trip we only paid 7 euros...live and learn. Termini Station has a wide variety of shops and stores on the lower level for all kinds of shopping. As another reviewer suggested, we visited a small grocery store downstairs and bought fresh fruit, snacks and a pack of bottled water. Much cheaper than what the hotel will sell you water for (about $3 for each 16 oz bottle at the hotel). The hotel offers a good complimentary breakfast from 7 am to 10 am. Don't expect pancakes or waffles. They have an assortment of cold cuts and cheese, scrambled eggs and pastries. They have several kinds of juices and wonderful coffee. They also have cold cereals and yogurt. My tip is load up on the breakfast...it will tide you over until lunch. When in Rome, do as the Romans do...buy a sandwhich and some fruit at any of the restaurants you pass by in Termini. Have them wrap it and take it with you. You can buy drinks just about everywhere and Rome is great for public water fountains. Keep an empty bottle handy and keep refilling it. People were extremely helpful and you will be surprised how far hand signs will take you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CreepingAsh
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault the location of this hotel. Right at the entrance of the Termini station in Rome. Our room was fine, air con was a little noisy but it worked. The bed was comfortable enough, the bathroom had a reasonable finish but to be honest the whole place needs an uplift. Traffic noise was audible through the closed windows. Sometimes I thought the windows were open! It wasn't a major problem though. The beauty of this hotel is that most of the big attractions in Rome are within reasonable walking distance, and if you don't want to walk the station is across the road. A good base for a Rome adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Lazman123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome for 5 nights and was going to stay in this hotel for the whole trip.. I moved out after i got moved from room to room and each room had issues... The staff were trying to convince me that no hotels in the area have working bar fridges and that I'd need to buy all my drinks from the hotel vending machines... Anyways after an argument with staff i left and walked 20 meters to a cleaner, better hotel with a working fridge :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - New Marble Bathrooms - Lots of Space - Clean!”
Reviews.Author: lovesworldtravel88
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome traveling with 3 girlfriends. Hotel Madison was above my expectations! - Clean rooms - Large marble bathrooms - 4 single beds given in large room - Very good free breakfast - Great location - Quiet All and all we would go back again forsure! Tip* We were spending so much money on waterbottles bought from kiosks and such. There is a grocery store downstairs in the trainstation that has tons of stuff and a six pack of water for $2. Fill up there! Rome is very hot in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap standard hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: Across the street from the train station exit, but noise did not bother us. Big hotel, lots of rooms. 1 small elevator. Small front desk. First room was small and had water leak somewhere and smelled bad, and window was not installed right. Bathroom was big. We got a room change no problem. Second room was also small standard room for Rome. It had weak AC. Bathroom had a weird design and was smaller than the first, with a bidet having more room than the toilet. Low shower pressure. Toiletries and outlets okay. No internet access, but down the street from a VERY CHEAP INTERNET CAFE. Beds and pillows were okay, cheap and firm. In-room safe. No minibar. Very small crappy tv with very few working channels, CNN in English, but with static. Okay staff. Free buffet breakfast was good with cereals, breads, pastries, spreads, deli ham, 2 cheeses, scrambled eggs & bacon, coffees & teas & processed juices.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Dofer
Reviews.Content: I looked for two factors in my hotel: Location and Quietness. The location was obviously great, just across the Termini central train station. The soundproof windows worked well, and although my room was in front of the street, the noise from the street didn't penetrate the room. There was also a fine isolation between the rooms themselves, I couldn't hear the people in the rooms near door, unless they were closing doors or closets (and for some reason, they were closing closets all night long in my second night there). The other elements of this hotel were a positive surprise. My room was very clean, shower was good, staff was nice, and the breakfast really enjoyable. The bed wasn't too comfortable though, and if you need a good bed, this can be a problem. Also there was noise early in the morning, of doors and closets, from the hallway and the rooms next door It's not a perfect hotel, but for that kind of hotels in Italy, it is relatively good and fair priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful Desk staff. Small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: eurotrotter
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located (Stazione Temini just across the street - therefore public transport easily reachable).Reception staff very helpful. Rooms are small but comfortable and with functionable air conditioner - a must because it was very hot. Rooms are on 4th & 5th floors and reachable (a matter of speech) by 2 very slow lifts that scare the life out of you every time you use them (making a lot of sounds etc. Sometimes we preferred climbing the stairs . Breakfast was good a continental buffet + ham & cheeses. On the whole we had an adequate 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Kerricakes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here to Rome for our Honeymoon in October 2009. We are from Ontario Canada. As far as a 3 star here in Canada and in Rome it is a little different. The bathroom was awesome, always hot running water. The marble/granite in the bathroom was beautiful and also followed through into the room. Cherry wood was very pretty. No bugs at all in room 105. You could see a little wear in the coronors of the room but still very clean and bright. Room was smaller but really all we needed as we were out and about in Rome a lot. Front desk staff were always nice bright and smiling! Although between 9-11 they are busy as a lot of guests are checking out. Breakfast was way better than expected, meat, cheese, hard boiled eggs, crossiants(which were amazing), toast, cereal of 3 kinds, sometimes fruit, tea, coffee, juice of 4 kinds. You can also ask them to bring expresso to your table also. This hotel is very quiet even though it is right across from the Termini(train station). We felt very safe staying here and would so again for sure! Issues: the phone in the room did not work! We told them a number of times and the phone would work for 2 days and then go dead again. Positive is that the front desk attendants were very nice and helpful and would always let us use their phone or call the numbers for us. This hotel is right in the heart of Rome. 15 Min away from Colessum, 20-25 from Pantheon and Trivi Fountian. about 60 Min walk from the Vatican City. We did lots of walking and you can get around by bus but we wanted to explore the city our selves. Again we had a really good time and would consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lamotta_bp
Reviews.Content: ++ nice room, but nothing special -- very bad breakfast, expensive for the quality one bottle of water in the fridge, nothing else. We had to pay 1 euro for that at the end, we thought it was a gift from the hotel (as this was the only drink in the fridge). very small tv.. disappointed..

Reviews.Title: “Madison hotel-NICE&CLEAN :)”
Reviews.Author: 984mirif
Reviews.Content: Hello We booked the hotel for 5 nights after reading the mixed reviews of it. We were glad to find nice & clean room, that was cleaned every day when we were gone, helpfull staff that gave us a map of the sity and helped with directions and reccomendations. Tha maid eved changed all of the 7 towels in the bathroom everyday. We asked for double bed, but got 2 singles,this was ok since the beds didn't moove in the midle, so we were pleased.The "cable TV" is 10 channels in Italian & CNN in english, so don't count on watching TW :) Also no DVD or anything of this sort. The bathroom was nice-all marvel.You even get small soups and shampoo every day. Only problem is that the bath itself is "shorter" than what you used at at home :) But you have hot water all day long,which is great!! Breakfast-not so great,but you can have a Sereal with juse or coffe, some cheese,bacon, cold omlett... Overall, we liked the hotel and will return :)

Reviews.Title: “Madison 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: belly5uk
Reviews.Content: My wife & I went to Rome last year (2008) and stopped at the Madison. Not the best area to stay, but ideal to get about being across the road from the Terminii. With the city open bus tours starting down the road and the Metro across the road this hotel is well placed. The hotel it's self is clean and the staff friendly. My only gripe is the coffee for breakfast comes from a flask (I feel not proper coffee as the Italians would drink).

Reviews.Title: “not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Holly11Wales
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. My husband was lecturing in Rome for one day and the hotel was booked for him by the client he was working for. I joined him for an extra couple of days. We arrived late on the Friday evening, and having looked at the website, couldn't believe this was the same hotel. The guy on reception was reasonably friendly but no one was around to help with the luggage. The lift was very dodgy and we both had the feeling it could break down at any minute. The room was dark and cramped but it was the bathroom that really angered us. Incredibly narrow and the shower stall was so tiny. Any idea of having a relaxing, refreshing shower quickly disappeared. This was a double room but the toiletries were a joke. No box of tissues and just one small bottle of shower gel. They couldn't have made it less attractive if they'd tried. It was a very warm night but the 'air conditioning' that is mentioned on the website was more like a fan blowing hot air. By the time we'd unpacked we were both too tired to complain and proceeded to have a very uncomortable night's sleep. The bed was two twins pushed together, one paper thin pillow each and a rock solid mattress. Breakfast was ok, although the staff were very unwelcoming. Well, at least this review has a happy ending. When my husband finished work on Saturday afternoon, we checked out of this dump and booked into the Hilton. Absolute paradise. I realise you get what you pay for in this world, but this hotel is supposed to be 3 star. I wouldn't give it 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good experience at Hotel Madison in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ejill
Reviews.Content: We've read the negative reviews, and have a hard time correlating them to our experience ... we arrived in Rome tired and worn out and the hotel was completely accommodating and helpful. We found the hotel to be so very convenient -- close to the Termini station, but also walkable to the ancient sites, which we walked to without too much trouble (the Colliseum and Forum are NOT that far away!) I have severe knee problems, and I was able to do it without difficulty. Our room was very, very nice -- much bigger than we thought it might be -- and the bathroom was luxurious, although strangely without a shower curtain. Our only complaint was that the water out of the bathroom faucets was not potable -- something we found out only AFTER we drank some. In Rome, this is less of a problem than it sounds, as there are free public water fountains EVERYWHERE. The air conditioning was just adequate to keep the room comfortable. Otherwise, our room exceeded our expectations. We thought we got a great deal on the hotel and were very satisfied. In fact, we tried to change our reservations to stay the whole time at the Madison (as it was so much nicer than we expected) but were not able to as it was booked. Breakfast was very good -- I especially enjoyed the yogurt, granola and coffee -- all of which were wonderful. It's true the halls are somewhat of a maze, but we thought that was fun, and not at all dark or scary. The neighborhood is what you would expect 50 feet from a train station, but we didn't find it scary, either -- you just had to keep your wits about you. We heard NOTHING at night -- our room was well-insulated. Overall, our stay at the Hotel Madison was a good one, and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: TheHagueAndrea_g
Reviews.Content: we booked a double room, but when we arrived the gave us a single room, saying they would change it the next day. The next day when we asked for another room, they said it wasn't possible because nobody had written down we should change rooms. So we had to sleep 2 out of 3 nights in a single room. Breakfast is bad, coffee and bread tastes like it's been lying there for days. The hotel is like a maze, verry uncomfortable if you're carrying a lot of luggage. The website says it's nearby a lot of sightseeings, but everything is far away, you need to take the bus for every place you want to go. An d the hood is scary at night. T he hotel doesn't look like the pictures on the website at al and the windows in the rooms won't open, in case of robbery, which makes it verry suffocating.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth any money”
Reviews.Author: cindy60
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a rat hole. There is no air conditioning. The staff is not helpful. The location is on the wrong side of the tracks. No money is worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “scary location”
Reviews.Author: kiraywm
Reviews.Content: We walked straight past our hotel when trying to find it. Dont stay on this side of the Termini railway, its considered the 'dodgy' side. There are alot of scary looking people, and the tourist spots are on the -other- side of the railway. Aside from that, the hotel itself is actually decent. It was a maze to get to our room. The room was large, and so is the bathroom. It was quite clean from memory. The staff dont look friendly and arent really helpful either. They dont even come to open the door for you when they see you're carrying things and having difficulty getting in.

Reviews.Title: “an okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmc9004
Reviews.Content: Hotel Madison was okay. We only stayed one night. It doesn't look quite like the pictures on the website. The decor is old and dingy. The elevators were very small. The hallways were like a dark maze. It's possible to get lost. The room was a decent size. It was clean. The lighting was dim and it was very stuffy in the room. The AC didn't work so we opened the window to discover a creepy courtyard. We were somewhat afraid because we heard dogs barking ferociously and a bird almost flew in. Therefore, we closed the window and tolerated the stuffy air all night. The bathroom was nice. Very clean and modern. The toilet was a little too close to the wall. My 5' 3" 125lb. body had to sit sideways. There was a sign next to the sink stating that the water was undrinkable. I'd recommend this hotel if you're not looking for luxury. Good location for tourists. Directly across the street from Termini. There were some shady people outside but it's safe as long as you're not alone.

Reviews.Title: “The location and breakfast do little to make up for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelJenni
Reviews.Content: The proximity of this hotel to the train station and the underground is great. However, it's kind of in a seedy area. There wasn't a day that went by that I didn't see some type of bio-refuse on the sidewalk in front of this hotel. The front desk clerks were nice and the breakfast is good, but the air conditioning didn't work and we were in Rome in the middle of summer. When we returned one day, they told us there had been a problem with our room, as a pipe had sprung a leak, so we were moved to it's sister hotel, a few blocks away. We were given directions and made to walk 2 miles away. The next day, as were checking out, the clerk said he lost our reservation and made us pay twice. We were in such a hurry to get to the airport, we just paid it and filed a claim when we got home. We still haven't got the issue resolved. This hotel is not worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Madison”
Reviews.Author: Lohpan
Reviews.Content: I would consider this hotel a 2 star for several reasons. The biggest problem I had with this hotel is the the water from the bathroom sink was not potable. There were signs stuck to the bathroom mirror that said not the drink the water. The other problem was the location of this hotel, right across from termini with all of the problems that ensue being right next to a major train station. This is my 4th trip in 4 years to Rome, first and last time at the Madison.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for less than honest staff”
Reviews.Author: abh82
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt that this hotel is in a great location for access to the city. The main downtown area is an easily walkable distance but your also beside the main bus, train and metro station. The coach from Ciampino dropped us right beside the hotel. On first glance, the hotel looks fairly grubby on the outside but inside it was pretty ok and I was surprised how nice the bedroom and bathroom were. During our stay we noted that the bathroom toiletries were being refilled each day rather than replaced. Also, the bins weren't always emptied each day. These are both minor complaints. The main issue I had with the hotel as after I left. When i arrived back in Dublin I realised I hadn't cleared the wardrobe before we left and I had left two expensive dresses behind me. I rang the hotel within an hour of arriving home and they said i'd have to call again in the morning which i did. i was sent from pillar to post and each person said that nothing had been found. When I asked about the room we stayed in they'd say nothing was found and would quote a different room number altogether. I called and called and called and it wasn't until i suggested to the receptionist that they must have been stolen that she suddenly said they had been found that very morning. My friend who lives in Rome collected the package from the hotel that day but when it was opened it was found to contain a t-shirt and skirt, obviously the lost property of someone else who may have been also trying to get it back. i can only assume that somewhere in Rome there is a woman the same size as me walking around in my two dresses.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: ben101
Reviews.Content: basic but pleasant place to stay.rooms are clean staff are friendly great location and reasonably priced.would have rated even higher if it had a bar or restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: mellonhead
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Madison. Check in time was 2pm, abit late as far as I'm concerned, but the staff were very friendly and looked after our luggage until later. The location itself was awesome. The hotel was literally across the road from the entrance of termini station. We got the coach from Ciampino, and it dropped us more or less outside our hotel; couldn't be better! The hotel room was very clean, and looked the part! Air conditioning, and had a really very nice and functional bathroom - the shower was very good! My only complaint about the madison was the view from our room. Our room was at the back of the hotel, and our view was across a courtyard at some pretty slummy flats - but considering theres far too much sighseeing to do, this was a small sacrifice to make - after all, you come to Rome to see the sights, and not what's out your bedroom window! The breakfast in the morning was really good - cereals, rolls with cheese and assorted meats, cakes, and fresh hot coffee and tea, and also a range of juices. I'd give the Madison 9/10 - I'd definately recommend it to the serious traveller

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FluffyMuffy
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a fantastic location, literally across the road from Termini station. So it is within walking distance of most sights, or right beside the metro, buses and taxis. The room was a decent size, good sized bathroom (with decent shower), beds very comfortable and the room was very clean. The room was cleaned, beds made, towels changed every day. Staff were fairly friendly, although their English wasn't fantastic, but then we were in Italy. Only real downside was the breakfast. I would go to one of the cafes next door, or across to Termini. I would recommend this hotel as a great base to see Rome. For goodness sake take some very comfortable trainers, there is a lot of waking to be done.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: reg77
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in great location. Large bed, clean and tidy great shower and bath. Nice staff. Nice decor. Very highly recommended. Great value compared to others we have used/seen in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: littlesthobo1978
Reviews.Content: Arrived well before check-in and they let us up to our room early. Is a great location, just down the street from where the airport bus drops you off and directly facing the train/bus station. Rooms were very dark but clean and comfortable. Mini Bar was very very cheap and ensuite bathroom was huge. Supplied with Shampoo, Soap, Shower caps and shower gel. The worst bit were the lifts, I am unsure they have ever been serviced and getting into them you kind of felt like you were taking your life in your hands! There are stairs of course which we generally took instead. Breakfast I was not impressed with, I am allergic to wheat and the choice for me was very small. I had ham and cheese most days which to be honest wasnt worth getting out of bed for. Other things on offer included croissants, bread cakes, pastries, cereal and boiled eggs. The hotel suited us fine and was great value for money, it was basic but it was clean, the receptionist was friendly and helpful, the rooms had two beds, a tv, mini bar and a desk with mirror. All we needed for our 3 night stay. There is so much to see in Rome you are not in your room much anyway and this was a perfect base, close to the station where you could take a bus anywhere. Rome is an amazing city, I would recommend it to anyone - not the best for coeliacs though - I would do your research before you go!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel For Its Price & Place”
Reviews.Author: ran.greece
Reviews.Content: went to rome for four days and stayed at the madison hotel very close to termini station(right across)this was very good for all our transportations including to/fm the airport good breakfast clean rooms staff was ok The area is not one of the best in rome BUT VIA MARSALA IS A SAFE ROAD AND THE HOTEL HAS AN EXCELLENT POSITION would go again if i had to choose a hotel in the center of rome

Reviews.Title: “not for us i'm afraid”
Reviews.Author: derbrough
Reviews.Content: picked this hotel for some of the reviews i read prior to booking and also checked out pictures on the hotel's website.stayed in a quad room which is really a double with four single beds in it,three of which are pushed right up together top make one.bathroom is the thinnest i have ever seen.impractical to actually sit and do your business with any kind of comfort.fridge was the same temperature as room and remote control didnt work.hotel was clean but not in my eyes a three star property.location of hotel pretty good if you are dependant on public transport to get to airport however the termini train station right beside attracts lots people lying about drinking day and night.need to watch where you step.disappointed more by the area than actual hotel snd wouldn't be in any rush back.

Reviews.Title: “The Madison was excellant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I have just returned from our first (but not last) trip to Rome. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the rooms were serviced every day by friendly staff and where else can you get a beer from a mini bar that costs less than in a cafe/bar in the city. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and restocked regularly. The rooms were well equipped with a/c, tv, full bathroom and hairdryer and had recently being redecorated. The only downside was the rabit warren layout of the rooms which made it difficult to find your room, especially after a few Chianti's Highly recommended, central location, we walked to all the major tourist sites,( especially on day 3 when the bus and metro service were on strike) Darrel Lindley and Andrew Lawn Leeds England

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Madison Rome ~ Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located just opposite the Termini and Rome Ciampino Airport drop off point. (Between 5&8 euro for the bus transfer per person) However there was not excessive noise and no trouble with people from the Termini. From the first impression to leaving this hotel I was happy with everything on offer. The staff were helpful and friendly and spoke a good level of English. Two lifts took you from the beautiful marble entrance to the rooms. Our room was on the 6th floor but remained quite easily accesable to us. The room was small but had everything we needed. The beds were comfortable but were 2 singles pushed together. The room featured a fridge and reasonably priced mini bar. (1 euro for a bottle of water) There was plenty of storage and a writing desk. The ensuite was clean and featured a really classy suite which was tiled in dark marble. The breakfast was basic continental food but there was plenty of it with something for everyone including fresh juice, yoghurt and cereals. On the whole we were very impressed with the overall value and experience of the hotel. OK the room was not luxury but for the very reasonable price we paid it represented an excellent deal. We would reccomend it to any travellers looking for a good value hotel which is close to the amenities that isn't looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, in a single 'special offer' room. The room was a reasonable size, with a good, new bathroom. However, although there was a window which opened onto a courtyard, there was no natural light and it was warm, even in October. Nevertheless, it was very good value for money and fine for a short stay. The buffet breakfast was very good. The hotel was clean and well kept, generally and the staff pleasant and helpful. The situation, opposite the main railway station, was very convenient for travelling around.

Reviews.Title: “Madison Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Madison Hotel in Rome. The staff were very unfriendly and the accommodation nothing like the photograghs on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Madison Hotel for 2 nights in July 05 and thought it was great. Room and bathroom were very clean with really nice air con which was already switched on in our room so it was always cool. We had no problems in our room and the bonus of having MTV and a cold fridge in the room meant after a long day of sightseeing we were able to relax with a cold drink. Staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good, with lots to choose from. After reading other reviews I was a bit scared of what the area was going to be like but it was ok (although there were quite a few dodgy looking people hanging around), and the proximity to Termini station (literally opposite the hotel) meant that we could easily get around all the sights. In Termini if you go down the escalator and turn right there is a small supermarket selling food and drink that you could take up to your room and keep in the fridge. We bought lots of water (v. cheap) and some fruit that we took with us when we went sightseeing. The other guests were quiet and were mostly students and young families, so we had no problems. Overall a very good hotel for what we paid (£130 altogether for flights and hotel) and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost suffocated to death”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no air circulation in the room. We were told there is only heat and no air conditioning. We turned the "machine" on anyway, and it made such annoying noise. We opened the big window, and shocked to see tons of aluminum pipes running up the back side of the building. For security and possible rats problem, we kept the window closed, and sweat ourselves to sleep. Breakfast is OK. The only single positive thing about this hotel is its proximity to the termini.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a Danish cuople (25 and 30 years of age) and had booked a room for 5 nights at the Hotel Galles, which is closer to the more quiet university area. However when we arrived we were told that the hotel was full, even though we had a reciept and confirmation on the room. We were told that they had a similar hotel (Madison) closer to the central station. Our 5 nights at Hotel Madison were terrible: a group of yuong American students were running around, slamming the doors, shouting all night until 2 in the morning. The we turned in a complaint but the hotel did nothing about it. We then got a room on the 6th floor which was supposed to be more calm, however they were doing renovation of the room next door, so hardly any sleep there as well. The breakfast was way below what one could expect I would strongly recommend that those of you who want to stay in Rome to relax, should NOT stay at the Hotel Madison. It is a youth hostel rather than a hotel, and the staff is arrogant and not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Madison for 4 nights in October 2004. Our room was dark, dingy and depressing. There was a large waterstain on the wall and the bathroom was tiny with a shower that had a blocked drain. We tried to minimise our time in the room. We had no option but to open the windows to get some fresh(?) air, and when we did so the noise from the street was almost intolerable. The walls also appeared to be paper thin as we kept getting woken up by the sounds of people in the corridors and next rooms. The breakfast was nothing to get excited over - basically just croissants and bread rolls. The only good thing about the hotel was its proximity to Termini station - but I am sure that you could get better value for money in some of the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Camera stolen from room”
Reviews.Author: Kylie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August with my parents. One evening when we went out for dinner they left there video camera in the room. When they returned it was gone. We went to the reception to report the theft and all of a sudden the receptionist no longer spoke English. After much hassle they agreed to call the police. The police told us it was not a break-in - it was definitely an "inside job". The hotel was in a good location and was reasonably priced but having a member of staff steal my parents video camera completely ruined out Rome experience. Only stay here if you leave NOTHING of value in your room.
